**Fire Storm** is a level 9 [Fire Magic](/Fire_Magic "Fire Magic")/[Conjurations](/Conjurations "Conjurations") spell that deals 50% resistible [fire](/Fire "Fire") damage centered on a visible, open square (occupied or not) in a 5-tile range. It creates a fiery explosion of 3-4 tile radius (including the center tile), fills it with [flame clouds](/Flame_cloud "Flame cloud"), and summons a handful of [fire vortices](/Fire_vortex "Fire vortex"). Higher [spellpower](/Spellpower "Spellpower") increases damage, and the chance of a 4-tile explosion.

The [vortices](/Fire_vortex "Fire vortex") Fire Storm creates are weak and confused friendly monsters that wander around, meleeing enemies for a bit of additional damage. They have low HP and die after scoring a single hit, but can serve as a distraction and even get in the way of projectiles or spells. They will be hostile if you worship [Okawaru](/Okawaru "Okawaru") or have [Sacrificed Love](/Ru#Sacrifices "Ru").

## Contents

- [1 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [1.1 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [2 Gallery](#Gallery)
- [3 History](#History)

## Strategy

Fire Storm is one of the strongest spells in the game, [smite-targeted](/Smite-targeted "Smite-targeted"), and only 50% resistible. Even monsters immune to fire, such as [orbs of fire](/Orbs_of_fire "Orbs of fire"), can be destroyed in a few casts. However, as a level 9 dual-school spell, it's very difficult to learn in a 3-rune game. Both [Ashenzari](/Ashenzari "Ashenzari") and [Vehumet](/Vehumet "Vehumet") can expedite the process, but even with these gods, Fire Storm is a hefty investment.

This spell has minor downsides:

- It causes a real [ruckus](/Noise "Noise"), akin to shouting at the targeted location. You could get swarmed when you really don't want to.
- It has a random radius, which makes it difficult to target adjacent monsters without hitting yourself. Even with rF+++, a player takes around 8d8 damage, and that's before power boosts. [Blink](/Blink "Blink"), [Dispersal](/Dispersal "Dispersal"), or [Disjunction](/Disjunction "Disjunction") can create a distance from enemies.

Keep some single-target damage spells in your repertoire for monsters that don't deserve 9 MP worth of fiery death.

### Tips & Tricks

- Fire Storm can be used to attack targets from outside [LOS](/LOS "LOS"). Under normal circumstances, this requires a 4-tile radius explosion.

* You can consistently attack outside LOS with [Vehumet](/Vehumet "Vehumet")'s range increase, a [scarf](/Scarf "Scarf") of [shadows](/Shadows "Shadows"), or the innate LOS radius of [Kobolds](/Kobold "Kobold"). You can also attack monsters around corners, no matter the character.

## Gallery

[![](/images/thumb/9/9b/Fire_storm.jpg/250px-Fire_storm.jpg)](/File:Fire_storm.jpg)



Casting Fire Storm. Notice the friendly fire vortices.

## History

- Prior to [0.30](/0.30 "0.30"), Fire Storm was 55% resistible.
- Prior to [0.17](/0.17 "0.17"), Fire Storm's blast was circular rather than square. The chance for a radius-4 blast was slightly lower as a result, and not possible if power was less than 76.

Strategy

However, as a level 9 dual-school spell, it's very difficult to learn in a 3-rune game. Both Ashenzari and Vehumet can expedite the process, but even with these gods, Fire Storm is a hefty investment.

This spell has minor downsides:

  • It causes a real ruckus, akin to shouting at the targeted location. You could get swarmed when you really don't want to.
  • It has a random radius, which makes it difficult to target adjacent monsters without hitting yourself. Even with rF+++, a player takes around 8d8 damage, and that's before power boosts. Blink, Dispersal, or Disjunction can create a distance from enemies.

Keep some single-target damage spells in your repertoire for monsters that don't deserve 9 MP worth of fiery death.

Tips & Tricks

  • Fire Storm can be used to attack targets from outside LOS. Under normal circumstances, this requires a 4-tile radius explosion.
You can consistently attack outside LOS with Vehumet's range increase, a scarf of shadows, or the innate LOS radius of Kobolds. You can also attack monsters around corners, no matter the character.
